description: shoutout independent presidential candidate from New York in 2016; Dat Ass
one of the last remnants of this art is stand-up comedy, which has its own mixed culture, but at least the same skillset is prized and cultivated

this is, of course, a half-century-long bastardization of the platonic ideal of storytelling; ie, being compelling enough to maintain the attention of your friends around the campfire, which had all sorts of its own little tricks (voices! act-outs! integration of natural occurrences!)

this is a worse version of the Netflix evolution of taking a normal TV show script, and then chopping every episode in half at what would normally be the commercial break, to better induce binge-watching (before streaming, shows would do this to get you to tune in next week, but it always seemed more intentional and less contrived)

the lazy creators just end the reel with and thats why I... and then it loops back to their intro- but the really skilled creators create a little portrait-sized black hole endless loop that you only realize 1.5 loops in, you could theoretically be stuck there forever
the algorithm made all the little videos start at the end, bending the entire concept of time, space, and sequence
Only in Kingston have I experienced people blasting reggae on the block in 35 degree weather
